description.en:
Course is designed for total beginners. Student will learn to read simple texts, to understand and use simple language and the basic structures of Russian grammar. The given grammar will have practical conversational orientation. Thus a student will be able to build up conversational formulas and develop basic speech habits.

The topics of the course (content of the course might slightly change depending on students' progress):

   Introducing oneself,
   Colours and adjectives,
   Countries, nationalities and languages,
   Family and friends,
   Professions and occupations,
   Numerals, phone numbers, addresses,
   Studies,
   Daily routine,
   Favourite things to do,
   Leisure time and hobbies.

The course focuses on the following grammatical topics: the gender of nouns and adjectives, all cases in singular, personal and possessive pronouns, verb conjugation in present, past and future (imperfective verbs).

objectives.en: The overall aim of the course is to provide a learner with basic knowledge of Russian and help to develop reading as well as basic oral and writing skills.

structural_unit.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.et: 1-2 Greeting and saying good-bye. Thanking. Apologising. Asking for a person's name. Asking a simple question about a person or an object. Cyrillic alphabet. Stressed and unstressed vowels. Stress in words. Hard and soft consonants. Voiced and voiceless consonants. Interrogative words.

3-4 Asking for a person's status. Nationalities and countries. Introducing oneself and someone. Names of the colours and basic adjectives. Characterising an object. Nominative case. Gender of nouns. Adjective endings. Personal pronouns. Prepositional case (to live in + country).
5-6 My Family. Asking and telling about family. Construction "I have". Russian names. Possessive pronouns. Complete and short answers. Accusative case (telling about someone's name). Test 1

7-8 Construction "I don't have" (absence of something or somebody). Different contexts of using Genitive case. Introducing Russian case system. Notes of cases. Genitive case in negative constructions and other contexts.

9-10 Professions and occupations. Numerals. Asking and telling a person's age. Further contexts of using Dative case. Talking about everyday activities. Dative case. Conjugation of the verbs in Present tense (type I and II). Reflexive verbs. Test 2

11-12 Days of the week. Asking and telling about actions in the past. Telling about plans. Talking about weather. Finding out the location. Past and Future tenses of verbs. Adverbs. Prepositional case denoting location. Using the correct preposition when talking about location.
13-14 Asking and telling about studies. My Day. My week. Asking and telling the time. Telling the time of an action. Accusative case denoting direct object of action. Accusative case denoting time.
15-16 Leisure time and hobbies. Expressing the attitude towards something. Asking and reporting about one's favourites and hobbies. Instrumental case denoting time. The irregular verbs. Test 3

17 Oral exam. Evaluation of the course.

*Content of the course might slightly change depending on students' progress.
